TASK-2 Implementation: Rename “Ambitions & Projects” → “Career Paths” (intern view)

Overview

Updated UI copy and navigation to show “Career Paths” for interns while preserving “Ambitions & Projects” for leaders and managers.

Changes Made

1. AppHeader Component (src/layout/AppHeader.tsx)

Added Role-Based Label Logic

  • Added labelIntern property to the routes configuration for the ambitions route
  • Implemented isLeaderOrManager check based on user’s access_role
  • Created displayLabel logic that shows:
    • “Career Paths” for interns (users without manager/leader role)
    • “Ambitions & Projects” for managers and leaders
const routes = [
    { id: "leadership", label: "Leadership", path: "/leadership", roles: ["manager", "leader"] },
    { id: "ambitions", label: "Ambitions & Projects", labelIntern: "Career Paths", path: "/ambitions", roles: [] },
    { id: "your-projects", label: "Your Projects", path: "/your-projects", roles: [] },
    { id: "requests", label: "Requests", path: "/requests", roles: [] },
];

const isLeaderOrManager = user?.access_role === 'manager' || user?.access_role === 'leader';

const availableRoutes = routes.filter(
    (r) => r.roles.length === 0 || (user?.access_role && r.roles.includes(user.access_role))
).map(route => ({
    ...route,
    displayLabel: route.labelIntern && !isLeaderOrManager ? route.labelIntern : route.label
}));

2. AmbitionsTab Component (src/components/carbon/AmbitionsTab.tsx)

Updated Page Title and Description

  • Added role-based page title logic
  • Updated description text for interns to emphasize career path selection
  • Preserved original content for leaders and managers
const isLeaderOrManager = accessRole === "manager" || accessRole === "leader";
const pageTitle = isLeaderOrManager ? "Ambitions & Projects" : "Career Paths";
const pageDescription = isLeaderOrManager 
  ? "Explore strategic initiatives and find projects that align with IBM's goals."
  : "Choose up to 3 Career Paths that interest you and discover projects to build your skills.";

Acceptance Criteria

✅ Top nav shows “Career Paths” for interns - Navigation menu dynamically displays based on user role - Interns see “Career Paths” in the header navigation - Leaders/managers see “Ambitions & Projects”

✅ Section copy updated: “Choose up to 3 Career Paths…” - Page description changes based on user role - Interns see: “Choose up to 3 Career Paths that interest you and discover projects to build your skills.” - Leaders/managers see original description

User Experience

For Interns

  • Navigation: “Career Paths” appears in the top navigation bar
  • Page Title: “Career Paths” displayed as the main heading
  • Description: “Choose up to 3 Career Paths that interest you and discover projects to build your skills.”

For Leaders/Managers

  • Navigation: “Ambitions & Projects” appears in the top navigation bar (unchanged)
  • Page Title: “Ambitions & Projects” displayed as the main heading (unchanged)
  • Description: “Explore strategic initiatives and find projects that align with IBM’s goals.” (unchanged)

Technical Implementation

Role Detection

The implementation uses the access_role field from the user object to determine which labels to display: - access_role === 'manager' → Shows leader/manager labels - access_role === 'leader' → Shows leader/manager labels - All other roles (including interns) → Shows intern-friendly labels

Files Modified

  1. src/layout/AppHeader.tsx - Navigation label logic
  2. src/components/carbon/AmbitionsTab.tsx - Page title and description logic

Testing Recommendations

  1. Test with different user roles:
    • Login as an intern → Verify “Career Paths” appears in nav and page
    • Login as a manager → Verify “Ambitions & Projects” appears
    • Login as a leader → Verify “Ambitions & Projects” appears
  2. Verify functionality:
    • All existing features should work identically
    • Only the labels/copy should change based on role
    • No breaking changes to existing functionality
  3. Cross-browser testing:
    • Test in Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge
    • Verify responsive design on mobile devices

Future Enhancements

  1. Internationalization: Add i18n support for multiple languages
  2. Customizable Labels: Allow admins to customize labels per organization
  3. A/B Testing: Track engagement metrics to optimize copy
  4. Onboarding: Add tooltips or guided tours for first-time users
